bibl.title: Military Orders for James Carroll, February 6, 1901 [selected page]

div1.p: Special Orders #31 orders Carroll to report to Washington, D. C. for duty in the pathological laboratory of the Army Medical Museum. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for James Carroll, February 6, 1901 [selected page]
div1.p:
FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Spec Orders
Vol 1 - 1901

during the examination of Captain Jefferson D. Poindexter,
assistant surgeon, U. S. Army, only. Major Merrill is hereby
relieved as a member of the board to take effect upon the com-
pletion of Captain Poindexter's examination.

12. By direction of the Secretary of War, Acting Assistant ✓
Surgeon James Carroll, U. S. Army, will proceed from Colum-
bia Barracks, Cuba, to Washington, District of Columbia, and
report in person to the Surgeon General of the Army for duty
in the pathological laboratory of the Army Medical Museum
at the latter place. The travel enjoined is necessary for the
public service.
✓

13. By direction of the Secretary of War, Acting Assistant
Surgeon Matthew A. DeLaney, U. S. Army, will proceed from
the National Soldiers' Home, Virginia, to Fort Monroe, Vir-
ginia, and report in person to the commanding officer of that
post for temporary duty and by letter to the commanding gen-
eral, Department of the East. The travel enjoined is necessary
for the public service.

14. By direction of the Secretary of War, so much of para-
graph 20, Special Orders, No. 10, January 12, 1901, from this
office, as directs 2d Lieutenant Edgar H. Yule, 2d U. S. In-
fantry, to rejoin his proper station upon the arrival of 1st
Lieutenant G. Soulard Turner, 10th U. S. Infantry, at the
recruiting office at Indianapolis, Indiana, is amended so as to
direct Lieutenant Yule to remain on recruiting duty until fur-
ther orders.
BY COMMAND OF LIEUTENANT GENERAL MILES:

This is (dup) S O 31.
Hdqts of the army
AGO Wash Feb 6, 1901
(for full copy See ROSS
Major Johnston
Assistant Adjutant General
